(Maxwell 132)<ref>{{cite book|last=Maxwell|first=William J|title=New Negro, Old Left: African-American Writing and Communism Between the Wars|year=1999|publisher=[[Columbia University Press]]|location=New York}}</ref> *The poet [[Allen Ginsberg]] references the Scottsboro Boys in his poem ''America'' '''Music''' *The American folk singer and songwriter [[Lead Belly]] commemorated the events in his song "The Scottsboro Boys".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.artistdirect.com/nad/window/media/page/0,,118822-507464,00.html |title=Leadbelly – Let It Shine on Me: The Scottsboro Boys – Free Song Clips, ARTISTdirect Network |publisher=Artistdirect.com |accessdate=September 20, 2009}}</ref> In the song, he warns "colored" people to watch out if they go to Alabama, saying that "the man gonna get ya", and that the "Scottsboro boys [will] tell ya what it's all about." *Metal/Rap band [[Rage Against the Machine|Rage Against The Machine]] provides imagery of the Scottsboro Boys in their music video "[[No Shelter]]", along with imagery of the executions of [[Sacco and Vanzetti]], two men who were also denied a fair trial in court and were executed by authorities.<ref>{{Citation|last=RATMVEVO|title=Rage Against The Machine – No Shelter|date=February 26, 2010|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6NEoesmnYU4|accessdate=September 29, 2016}}</ref>
'''Film and television''' *In 1976, [[NBC]] aired a [[TV movie]] called ''Judge Horton and the Scottsboro Boys'', based on the case. *In 1998, [[Court TV]] produced a television documentary on the Scottsboro trials for its ''Greatest Trials of All Time'' series.<ref>[http://imdb.com/title/tt0278402/ ''Crime Stories'': "The Scottsboro Boys" (1998)] at IMDb.</ref> *Daniel Anker and Barak Goodman produced the story of the Scottsboro Boys in the 2001 documentary ''[[Scottsboro: An American Tragedy]]'', which received an Oscar nomination. *[[Timothy Hutton]] starred in a 2006 film adaptation titled ''[[Heavens Fall]]''.<ref>[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0425094/ "Heavens Fall (2006)"] at IMDb.</ref>
'''Theater'''
* [[Jean-Paul Sartre]]'s 1946 play ''[[The Respectful Prostitute]]'' (''La Putain respectueuse''), in which a black man is wrongfully blamed for an incident on a train involving a white prostitute, is believed to have been based on the Scottsboro case.<ref>Julien Murphy, [https://books.google.com/books?id=UauQbwLOxo8C&pg=PA222&lpg=PA222&dq=%22the+respectful+prostitute%22+SARTRE+written+1946&source=bl&ots=ekQbHqVvRv&sig=k8QoPtyQ842uxQ02WU-pjFalIvk&hl=en&sa=X&ei=v21rVcHXPIHHsQT9nIHIBQ&ved=0CCoQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=%22the%20respectful%20prostitute%22%20SARTRE%20written%201946&f=false "Sartre on American Racism"], in Julie K. Ward, Tommy L. Lott (eds), ''Philosophers on Race: Critical Essays'', Blackwell, 2002, p. 222.</ref> *''[[The Scottsboro Boys (musical)|The Scottsboro Boys]]'' is a staged musical portrayal of the Scottsboro case. The show premiered [[Off Broadway]] in February 2010<ref>[[Lucy Komisar|Komisar, Lucy]] (March 30, 2010), [http://filmfestivaltraveler.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=654:scottsboro-boys-a-chilling-musical&catid=50:reviews&Itemid=73 {{"'}}The Scottsboro Boys' Is a Chilling Musical"], FilmFestivalTraveler.com, retrieved June 13, 2011.</ref> and moved to Broadway's [[Lyceum Theatre (Broadway)|Lyceum Theatre]] in October 2010. The show received good reviews, but closed on December 12, 2010.<ref>{{cite news |last=Healy | first=Patrick | title=Blackface and Bigotry, Finely Tuned |work=The New York Times|postscript=|date= October 12, 2010 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/17/theater/17scottsboro.html?_r=1&scp=1&sq=scottsboro%20boys&st=cse | accessdate = October 26, 2010 }}</ref><ref>Hernandez, Ernio (February 12, 2010), [http://www.playbill.com/news/article/136824-Stroman-Brings-New-Musical-The-Scottsboro-Boys-to-Off-Broadway "Stroman Brings New Musical ''The Scottsboro Boys'' to Off-Broadway"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110604192203/http://www.playbill.com/news/article/136824-Stroman-Brings-New-Musical-The-Scottsboro-Boys-to-Off-Broadway |date=June 4, 2011 }}, ''[[Playbill]]'', retrieved June 13, 2011.</ref> The musical opened in London's [[Young Vic Theatre]] in 2013 before moving to the [[Garrick Theatre]] in October 2014. *''Direct from Death Row The Scottsboro Boys'', a black ensemble vaudevillesque "play with music and masks" Mark Stein production, directed by Michael Menendian, and presented at Chicago's Raven Theatre during the 2015 and 2016 seasons.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Reid|first1=Kerry|title='Direct from Death Row The Scottsboro Boys'|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/theater/reviews/ct-scottsboro-boys-review-ent-0928-20150923-story.html|website=chicagotribune.com|publisher=Chicago Yribune|accessdate=July 25, 2016}}</ref>

{{Italic title}} '''''Scène à faire''''' ([[French language|French]] for "scene to be made" or "scene that must be done"; plural: ''scènes à faire'') is a scene in a book or film which is almost obligatory for a [[genre]] of its type. In the U.S. it also refers to a [[legal principle|principle]] in [[copyright law]] in which certain elements of a [[creative work]] are held to be not protected when they are mandated by or customary to the [[genre]].[http://www.ivanhoffman.com/scenes.html Scenes a Faire Under Copyright Law]. – Ivan Hoffman, B.A., J.D. ==Examples in different genres== For example, a [[spy novel]] is expected to contain elements such as [[Swiss banking|numbered Swiss bank account]]s, a [[femme fatale]], and various spy [[gadget]]s hidden in [[wristwatch]]es, [[belt (clothing)|belt]]s, [[shoe]]s, and other personal effects. The [[United States Court of Appeals]] for the Second Circuit interpreted the ''scènes à faire'' doctrine expansively to hold that a motion picture about the South Bronx would need to feature drunks, prostitutes, vermin, and derelict cars to be perceived as realistic, and therefore a later film that duplicated these features of an earlier film did not infringe.''Williams v. Crichton'', 84 F.3d 581, 583 (2d Cir. 1996), commenting on ''Walker v. Time Life Films, Inc.'', 784 F.2d 44 (2d Cir.), cert. denied, 476 U.S. 1159 (1986). These elements are not protected by copyright, though specific sequences and compositions of them can be. As another example, in [[computer programming]], it is often customary to list [[Variable (computer science)|variables]] at the beginning of the [[source code]] of a program. In some programming languages, it is required to also [[Declaration (computer programming)|declare]] the type of variable at the same time. Depending on the function of a program, certain types of variables are to be expected. If a program deals with files, variable types that deal with files are often listed and declared. As a result, variable declarations are generally not considered protected elements of a program. The [[United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit]] made this part of the analysis for infringement of non-literal elements of computer code in ''[[Computer Associates International, Inc. v. Altai, Inc.]]''''Computer Associates International, Inc. v. Altai, Inc.'', 982 F.2d 693 (2d Cir. 1992). In that case, the court added it into its [[Abstraction-Filtration-Comparison test|Abstraction-Filtration-Comparison]] test. ==Policy== The policy rationale of the doctrine of ''scènes à faire'' is that granting a first comer exclusivity over ''scènes à faire'' would greatly hinder others in the subsequent creation of other expressive works. That would be against the constitutionally mandated policy of the copyright law to promote progress in the creation of works, and it would be an impediment to the public's enjoyment of such further creative expressions. By the same token, little benefit to society would flow from grants of copyright exclusivity over ''scènes à faire''.See ''Short Tutorial Note on How the Merger Doctrine and Scènes à Faire Differently Address Relevant Market'', in [http://docs.law.gwu.edu/facweb/claw/ch4b.htm George Washington Univ. Computer Law]. In a business and computer program context, the doctrine of ''scènes à faire'' is interpreted to apply to the practices and demands of the businesses and industries that the given computer program serves. Hence, the concepts of idea vs. expression (merger doctrine) and ''scènes à faire'' relate directly to promoting availability of business functionality.See, e.g., ''Engineering Dynamics, Inc. v. Structural Software, Inc.'', 46 F.3d 408, 410 n.2 (5th Cir. 1995). In ''CMM Cable Rep., Inc. v. Ocean Coast Properties, Inc.'', 97 F.3d 1504 (1st Cir. 1996). the court compared the merger and ''scènes à faire'' doctrines. The court said that the two doctrines were similar in policy, in that they both sought to prevent monopolization of ideas. However, merger applied when idea and expression were inseparable, but ''scènes à faire'' applied despite separability where an external common setting caused use of common elements and thus similarity of expression.''CCM Cable'', 97 F.3d at 1522 n.25. ==Limits of doctrine== The doctrine must be a matter of degree—that is, operate on a continuum. Consider the Second Circuit's ruling that the ''scène à faire'' for a movie about the South Bronx would need to feature drunks, prostitutes, vermin (rats, in the accused and copyrighted works), and derelict cars. The principle must have a limit, however, so that something is outside the ''scènes à faire'' doctrine for South Bronx movies. Perhaps, cockroaches, gangs, and muggings are also part of the South Bronx ''scène à faire'', but further similarity such as the film having as characters "a slumlord with a heart of gold and a policeman who is a Zen Buddhist and lives in a garage" surely goes beyond the South Bronx ''scène à faire''. There must be some expression possible even in a cliche-ridden genre." ==Cases== *''[[Cain v. Universal Pictures]]'', 47 F.Supp. 1013 ([[United States District Court for the Southern District of California]] 1942) ::This was the case where the term was introduced, when the writer [[James M. Cain]] sued [[Universal Pictures]], the scriptwriter and the director for copyright infringement in connection with the film ''[[When Tomorrow Comes (film)|When Tomorrow Comes]]''. Cain claimed a scene in his book where two protagonists take refuge from a storm in a church had been copied in a scene depicting the same situation in the movie. Judge [[Leon Rene Yankwich]] ruled that there was no resemblance between the scenes in the book and the film other than incidental "scènes à faire", or natural similarities due to the situation.{{cite web |ref=harv |url=https://scholar.google.ca/scholar_case?case=5293541731877026047&hl=en&as_sdt=2&as_vis=1&oi=scholarr&sa=X&ei=qhviT-LHJcPu2gXmuojvCw&ved=0CAgQgAMoADAA |title=CAIN v. UNIVERSAL PICTURES CO., Inc., et al. |publisher=District Court, S. D. California, Central Division. |date=December 14, 1942 |first=Leon Rene |last=Yankwich |accessdate=2012-06-20}} *''Walker v. Time Life Films, Inc.'', 784 F.2d 44 ([[United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit|2d Cir]]. 1986) ::After the release of the film ''[[Fort Apache, The Bronx]]'', author Thomas Walker filed a lawsuit against one of the production companies, Time-Life Television Films (legal owner of the script), claiming that the producers infringed on his book ''Fort Apache'' (New York: Crowell, 1976. {{ISBN|0-690-01047-8}}). Among other things, Walker, the plaintiff, argued that: "both the book and the film begin with the murder of a black and a white policeman with a handgun at close range; both depict cockfights, drunks, stripped cars, prostitutes and rats; both feature as central characters third- or fourth-generation Irish policemen who live in Queens and frequently drink; both show disgruntled, demoralized police officers and unsuccessful foot chases of fleeing criminals." But the [[United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit]] ruled that these are stereotypical ideas, and that the [[United States copyright law]] does not protect concepts or ideas. The court ruling stated: ''"the book ''Fort Apache'' and the film ''Fort Apache: The Bronx'' were not substantially similar beyond [the] level of generalized or otherwise nonprotectible ideas, and thus [the] latter did not infringe copyright of [the] former."''Margolick, David. – Legal Notes: "Writer Told 'Ft. Apache' isn't Just His". – ''[[New York Times]]''. – August 25, 1985Beeber, Jessie, and Maura Wogan. – "Is Scènes à Faire Really 'Necessary'?". – ''Entertainment, Arts and Sports Law Journal''. – Spring 2004. – Vol. 15, No. 1 *''Joshua Ets-Hokin v. Skyy Spirits Inc.'', 225 F.3d 1068 ([[United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit|9th Cir]]. 2000) {{Wikisource|Ets-Hokin v. Skyy Spirits Inc.}} ::Another significant case in [[United States law]] was ''Ets-Hokin v. Skyy Spirits'' (2003), in which ''scenes à faire'' was upheld as an [[affirmative defense]] by the [[United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit]]. The case involved a commercial photographer, Joshua Ets-Hokin, who sued [[SKYY vodka]] when another photographer created advertisements with a substantially similar appearance to work he had done for them in the past. It was established that the similarity between his work and the later works of the photographer was largely mandated by the limited range of expression possible; within the constraints of a photo shoot for a commercial product there are only so many ways one may photograph a vodka bottle. In light of this, to establish copyright infringement, the two photos would have been required to be virtually identical. The originality of the later work was established by such minor differences as different shadows and angles.[https://www.law.cornell.edu/copyright/cases/225_f3d_1068.htm ''Ets-Hokin v. Skyy Spirits Inc. INC.'', 225 F.3d 1068 (9th Cir. 2000)]. – Legal Information Institute (LII). – Cornell University Law School[http://www.ca9.uscourts.gov/ca9/newopinions.nsf/04485f8dcbd4e1ea882569520074e698/add102410b4fb5af88256e5a0070788c/$FILE/9817072.PDF Joshua Ets-Hokin v. Skyy Spirits Inc.'', 225 F.3d 1068 9th Cir. 2000]. – [[United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit]]. – (Adobe Acrobat *.PDF document) * ''Gates Rubber Co. v. Bando Chemical Industries, Ltd.'', 9 F.3d 823 (10th Cir. 1993) ::A significant ''scènes à faire'' case in the computer program context is ''Gates v. Bando''. The court explained the policy and application of the doctrine to computer program copyright infringement cases in these terms:
::Under the ''scènes à faire'' doctrine, we deny protection to those expressions that are standard, stock, or common to a particular topic or that necessarily follow from a common theme or setting. Granting copyright protection to the necessary incidents of an idea would effectively afford a monopoly to the first programmer to express those ideas. Furthermore, where a particular expression is common to the treatment of a particular idea, process, or discovery, it is lacking in the originality that is the ''sine qua non'' for copyright protection. ::The ''scènes à faire'' doctrine also excludes from protection those elements of a program that have been dictated by external factors. In the area of computer programs these external factors may include: hardware standards and mechanical specifications, software standards and compatibility requirements, computer manufacturer design standards, target industry practices and demands, and computer industry programming practices.
* ''[[RG Anand v. Deluxe Films|RG Anand v. M/s Deluxe Films]]''{{Cite web|url = http://indiankanoon.org/doc/1734007/|title = RG Anand v. M/s Deluxe|date = |access-date = February 13, 2016|website = Indiankanoon|publisher = |last = |first = }}'', AIR 1978 SC 1613'' ::The plaintiff was the writer and producer of a play called "''Hum Hindustani''" that was produced in the period of 1953-1955. The play was based on the evils of provincialism. The defendant in 1956 produced a film called "''New Delhi''". One of the themes of the film was provincialism, too. While evaluating whether or not the defendant had infringed the plaintiff's copyright, the Supreme Court of India held:
There can be no copyright in an idea, subject matter, ''themes'', plots or historical or legendary facts and violation of the copyright in such cases is confined to the form, manner and arrangement and expression of the idea by the author of the copyright work. (emphasis supplied)
Therefore, the court held that there is a standard way of dealing with the theme of provincialism, and there can be no copyright over that theme. Consequently, a question of infringement does not even arise. ==See also== * [[Fair use]] * [[Idea-expression divide]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==Further reading== *[http://chillingeffects.org/fanfic/faq.cgi#QID232Frequently Asked Questions (and Answers) about Fan Fiction], [[Chilling Effects (group)|Chilling Effects]]. {{DEFAULTSORT:Scenes A Faire}} [[Category:Legal doctrines and principles]] [[Category:French legal terminology]] [[Category:Copyright law]]

The '''Senior Community Service Employment Program''' ('''SCSEP''') is a program of the [[United States Department of Labor]], its [[Employment and Training Administration]], to help more senior citizens get back into or remain active in the labor workforce. It is a community service and work-based training program.<ref>US Department of Labor, ETA, [http://www.doleta.gov/seniors/html_docs/AboutSCSEP.cfm "About SCSEP"]</ref> It does this through job skill training and employment assistance with an emphasis on getting a ready job with a suitable and cooperating company or organisation. In such a setting, the worker is paid the [[Minimum wage in the United States|United States minimum wage]], or the highest of Federal, State or local minimum wage, or the prevailing wage, for an average of 20 hours per week, and experiences on-the-job learning and newly acquired skills use. The intention is that through these community jobs, the older worker will gain a permanent job, not subsidized by federal government funds.
People who are 55 or older can obtain job training and job search services from SCSEP. In each area of the country, SCSEP services are accessed through local organizations. These are usually nonprofits, but sometimes a state agency will administer the program.
== Eligibility guidelines == The participant must be at least 55 years of age and from a family receiving regular cash welfare payments or with an annual family income of no more than 25% over the [[Poverty in the United States|Federal poverty level]] as defined by the [[United States Census Bureau]]. There are certain exclusions in the income calculation, such as [[Social Security Disability Insurance]] (SSDI).<ref>US Department of Labor, ETA, [http://wdr.doleta.gov/directives/attach/TEGL/TEGL12-06_508.pdf "Training and Employment Guidance Letter No. 12-06], December 28, 2006.</ref>
Enrollment priority is given to persons over age 60, veterans, and qualified spouses of veterans. Preference is given to minority, limited English-speaking, and Indian eligible individuals. Preference is also given to eligible individuals who have the greatest economic need.
== History == SCSEP was authorised by the [[United States Congress]] in Title V of the Older Americans Act of 1965 <ref>[[United States Code]], [https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/42/3056- US Code Section 42 , Chapter 35, Subchapter IX, § 3056] - Older American Community Service Employment Program</ref> and its later amendments <ref>United States Public Law, [http://www.doleta.gov/Seniors/other_docs/owp-106-501.pdf Amended Public Law for Title V] Public Law 106–501—NOV. 13, 2000 114 STAT. 2267, Title V—Amendment to Title V of the Older Americans Act of 1965, Section 501.</ref> to provide subsidized, part-time, community [[Public service|service]] work based training for low-income persons age 55 or older who have poor employment prospects. The program has evolved significantly in the last 50 years. The program is administered by nonprofit organizations and local government agencies.
== Controversy == Experience Works, Inc., was historically the largest provider of SCSEP services. In 2015, the grantee was cited for $1.6 million dollars in questioned costs by the Department of Labor. The report details the use of unrestricted and accrued annual leave to cover a $1.6 million grant overspend, which $1.4 million was used to pay participant wages and fringe benefits, the misuse of federal funds to cover activities including first-class travel, pet hotels, fruit bouquets, personal loans to the CEO, and frequent credit card use on entertainment and prohibited lobbying. The number now totals approximately $2 million in questioned expenses. <ref>[[U.S. Department of Labor, Monitoring Report, December 18, 2015]]. [https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B4wFqjuHcI_1X1FtMmpEUnEwRHM]</ref> In 2016, the U.S. Department of Labor issued a follow up report critical of current management for not taking any corrective actions to restore funds.<ref>[[U.S. Department of Labor, Report to Sally A. Boofer, 2016]]. [https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B4wFqjuHcI_1cFZaTldJTnc3OW8]</ref> As a result of the prior management's actions, the U.S. Department of Labor has revamped the funding for SCSEP and the Inspector General has expanded the investigation into the activities of the previous management.<ref>[[U.S. Department of Labor, Employment and Training Administration]]. [https://www.doleta.gov/grants/pdf/FOA-ETA-16-04-A.pdf]</ref> The federal investigation is aided by a whistleblower and other former employees. In September, 2016 the Inspector General issued a preliminary report describing the organization as financial insolvent and took steps to curtail and eliminate federal funding.<ref>[[Office of Inspector General, September 30, 2016]] [https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B4wFqjuHcI_1UlVSdkRGVGdCbUU]</ref> Subsequently, more than 100 employees were terminated as a result of the funding reduction and were paid only part of their accrued leave.
== Funding == SCSEP has received stable funding of $434,371,000 during the last several years. The Trump administration has called for the elimination of the program, which is meeting some resistance in Congress.
The most recent budget proposal from the White House would eliminate the program entirely.<ref>[https://www.dol.gov/sites/default/files/documents/general/budget/2016/CBJ-2016-V1-06.pdf U.S. Department of Labor]</ref>

(See [https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2012/04/02/us/the-events-leading-to-the-shooting-of-trayvon-martin.html aerial views] of points of interest.) | coordinates = {{coord|28.79295|-81.32965|type:landmark_source:Googlemaps_scale:5000|name=The Retreat at Twin Lakes Community in Sanford, Florida|display=inline, title}} | also known as = | cause = | first reporter = | filmed by = | participants = George Zimmerman (shooter) | outcome = | reported injuries = Fractured nose, lacerations to the back of the head. (Zimmerman)| reported death(s) = Trayvon Martin | burial = | inquiries = | inquest = | coroner = | suspects = | charges = [[First degree murder in the United States|Second-degree murder]],{{cite news|url=http://news.blogs.cnn.com/2012/04/11/prosecutor-to-announce-decision-on-zimmerman/|title=Zimmerman charged with second-degree murder|date=April 11, 2012|publisher=CNN|accessdate=April 11, 2012 |first1=Mallory |last1=Simon |first2=Jason |last2=Hanna}} [[lesser included offense]] of [[manslaughter]]. | verdict = Not guilty | convictions = | publication bans = | litigation = | awards = | website = | notes = }} On the night of February 26, 2012, in [[Sanford, Florida|Sanford]], [[Florida]], United States, [[George Zimmerman]] fatally shot [[Trayvon Martin]], a 17-year-old [[African American]] high school student. Zimmerman, a 28-year-old [[Multiracial|mixed race]] [[Hispanic]] man,{{#tag:ref| Zimmerman's father is white and his mother is Hispanic from Peru with some African ancestry. One of her grandfathers was [[Afro-Peruvian]].|group = "Note"|name = "ancestry"}} was the [[neighborhood watch]] coordinator for his [[gated community]] where Martin was visiting his relatives at the time of the shooting.{{cite news| url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2012-03-14/news/os-trayvon-martin-shooting-death-rally-20120314_1_demand-justice-fatal-shooting-bryant|title=Trayvon Martin: 'We are gathered here today to demand justice' in teen's fatal shooting|last=Prieto|first=Bianca|date=March 14, 2012|work=[[Orlando Sentinel]]|accessdate=March 20, 2012}}{{cite news|last1=Hamacher |first1=Brian |first2=Lisa |last2=Orkin Emmanuel|url=http://www.nbcmiami.com/news/George-Zimmerman-to-Make-First-Appearance-Before-Judge-Thursday-147134515.html |title=George Zimmerman Makes First Appearance Before Judge |publisher=[[WTVJ]] |date=April 13, 2012 |accessdate=April 21, 2012}}{{cite news|title=Trayvon Martin death spotlights neighborhood watch groups|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/03/23/us/trayvon-martin-death-spotlights-neighborhood-watch-groups.html?_r=1|work=The New York Times|accessdate=June 23, 2012|first1=Campbell|last1=Robertson|first2=John|last2=Schwartz|date=March 22, 2012}} Zimmerman shot Martin, who was unarmed, during a physical altercation between the two. Zimmerman, injured during the encounter, claimed self-defense in the confrontation. In a widely reported trial, Zimmerman was charged with murder for Martin's death, but acquitted at trial on self-defense grounds. The incident was reviewed by the [[United States Department of Justice|Department of Justice]] for potential civil rights violations, but no additional charges were filed, citing insufficient evidence. ==Parties involved== ===Trayvon Martin=== {{Main|Trayvon Martin}} Trayvon Benjamin Martin was the son of Sybrina Fulton and Tracy Martin, who were divorced in 1999. He was a [[high school junior|junior]] at [[Dr. Michael M. Krop High School]] and lived with his mother and older brother in [[Miami Gardens, Florida]].{{cite news|first=Audra D. S.|last=Burch|author2=Laura Isensee |title=Trayvon Martin: a typical teen who loved video games, looked forward to prom|date=March 22, 2012|newspaper=Miami Herald|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/news/state/florida/trayvon-martin/article1939761.html|accessdate=March 23, 2012}}{{cite news|last=Prieto|first=Bianca|author2=Robert Nolin |title=Tensions still simmer in Trayvon Martin shooting case|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2012-03-17/news/os-trayvon-martin-shooting-tension-20120317_1_shooting-death-english-teacher-uncle|accessdate=March 23, 2012|newspaper=[[Orlando Sentinel]]|date=March 17, 2012}}Odzer, Ari. "[http://www.nbcmiami.com/news/local/Krop-Senior-High-Students-Honor-Fallen-Classmate-Trayvon-Martin-With-Chain-of-Life-144022006.html Krop Senior High Students Honor Fallen Classmate Trayvon Martin With "Chain of Life"]." [[WTVJ]]. Tuesday March 27, 2012. Retrieved December 9, 2012. On the day he was fatally shot, he and his father were visiting his father's fiancée and her son at her town home in Sanford, Florida. She lived in [[The Retreat at Twin Lakes]], a multi-ethnic gated community where Martin had visited several times before.{{cite news|last=DeGregory|first=Lane|title=Trayvon Martin's killing shatters safety within Retreat at Twin Lakes in Sanford|url=http://www.tampabay.com/news/humaninterest/trayvon-martins-killing-shatters-safety-within-retreat-at-twin-lakes-in/1221799|accessdate=March 29, 2012|newspaper=Tampa Bay Times|date=March 25, 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/05/17/justice/florida-teen-shooting |title=Police: Trayvon Martin's Death Ultimately Avoidable|publisher=CNN |date=May 17, 2012|accessdate=June 15, 2012}}{{cite journal|title=Reporting Trayvon|url=http://www.cjr.org/behind_the_news/reporting_trayvon.php?page=all|journal=Columbia Journalism Review |date=April 2, 2012 |accessdate=June 12, 2012}} According to his autopsy, Martin was 5 feet 11 inches (1.80 m) tall and weighed 158 pounds (72 kg) at the time of his death.{{cite news |title=A review of the evidence released in the Trayvon Martin case|url= http://www.tampabay.com/news/a-review-of-the-evidence-released-in-the-trayvon-martin-case/1230750|work=Tampa Bay Times |date=May 17, 2012 |accessdate=June 30, 2012}} ===George Zimmerman=== {{Main|George Zimmerman}} [[File:Zimmerman, George - Seminole County Mug.jpg|thumb|upright=0.9|Mugshot of George Zimmerman in the Seminole County Sheriff's Office in 2012]] George Michael Zimmerman was born in [[Manassas, Virginia]]{{cite news|title=Trayvon Martin Shooting Fast Facts|url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/06/05/us/trayvon-martin-shooting-fast-facts|publisher=CNN|accessdate=July 12, 2013|date=June 25, 2013}} and is the son of Gladys (née Mesa) Zimmerman, born in [[Peru]],{{cite news|author=Francescani, Chris|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/04/25/us-usa-florida-shooting-zimmerman-idUSBRE83O18H20120425|title=George Zimmerman: Prelude to a shooting|agency=Reuters|date=April 25, 2012}} and Robert Zimmerman Sr., a retired Virginia [[magistrate]].{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/who-is-george-zimmerman/2012/03/22/gIQAkXdbUS_story.html|title=Who is George Zimmerman?|last=Manuel Roig-Franzia, |author2=Tom Jackman |author3=Darryl Fears|date=March 22, 2012|work=[[The Washington Post]]|accessdate=March 24, 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2122245/Trayvon-Martin-case-George-Zimmermans-brother-defends-father-attacks-Obama.html |title=Trayvon Martin case: George Zimmerman's brother defends him as his father attacks Obama |work=[[Daily Mail]] |date=April 5, 2012 |accessdate=April 14, 2012 |location=London}} At the time of the shooting, Zimmerman was employed as an insurance fraud investigator. He had been working toward an [[associate degree]] in criminal justice at [[Seminole State College of Florida|Seminole State College]].{{cite news|last=Robles |first=Frances |url=http://www.tampabay.com/news/publicsafety/crime/records-show-george-zimmerman-got-ds-in-criminal-justice-classes/1245098 |title=Records show George Zimmerman got D's in criminal justice classes |work=Tampa Bay Times |date=August 9, 2012 |accessdate=June 12, 2013}} In one of his interviews with the police, he said his goal was to become a judge.{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/06/22/us/documents-tell-zimmermans-side-in-martin-shooting.html | work=The New York Times | first1=Lizette | last1=Alvarez | first2=Timothy | last2=Williams | title=Documents Tell Zimmerman's Side in Martin Case | date=June 21, 2012}} At the time of his arrest on April 11, 2012, Zimmerman's height was reportedly 5 feet 7 inches {{nowrap|(1.70 m)}} and his weight {{nowrap|185 lb}} {{nowrap|(84 kg)}}, according to the Seminole County Sheriff's Office Inmate Booking record.[http://cfnews13.com/content/dam/news/static/cfnews13/documents/george-zimmerman-booking-report-0412.pdf Seminole County Sheriff's Office, "Zimmerman, George Michael"], Inmate Booking Information, Public Version, 4/11/2012 20:10. (PDF from Central Florida News 13) [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/shared/bsp/hi/pdfs/12_04_12zimmerman_booking_report.pdf (from BBC News)] Zimmerman's height was shown as 5 feet 8 inches {{nowrap|(1.73 m)}} and his weight at {{nowrap|200 lb}} {{nowrap|(91 kg)}} on the Sanford Police Department Offense Report for February 26, 2012, the night of the shooting.{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2012/05/17/us/trayvon-martin-documents.html | work=The New York Times | title=Documents in the Trayvon Martin Case | date=May 18, 2012}} Zimmerman and his wife moved to The Retreat at Twin Lakes in 2009.{{cite news|last=Rush|first=Annemarie|title=A Closer Look At George Zimmerman|url=http://www.insightoutnews.org/readings/a-closer-look-at-george-zimmerman/|accessdate=March 29, 2012|publisher=[[InsightOut News]]|date=March 29, 2012}} ===Sanford Police Department=== Bill Lee had been chief of the [[Sanford Police Department (Florida)|Sanford Police Department]] for ten months when the shooting of Martin occurred.{{cite news |url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2012-03-22/news/os-trayvon-martin-sanford-chief-20120322_1_chief-bill-lee-miami-teenager-investigation|title=Trayvon Martin case: Sanford Police Chief under fire in Trayvon Martin shooting case|work=[[Orlando Sentinel]]|accessdate=March 23, 2012 |date=March 22, 2012 |first1=Rene |last1=Stutzman |first2=Jeff |last2=Weiner}} Prior to Lee's becoming chief, the department had been accused of protecting relatives of police officers involved in violent incidents with blacks. The Martin case resulted in increased distrust between the police and Sanford's black community. On March 22, Chief Lee [[leave of absence|temporarily stepped down]] from his position because of public criticism over his handling of the Trayvon Martin shooting. In April, the Sanford City Commission refused to accept Lee's resignation and stated that "Lee's spotless record showed there needed to be further review to determine if he failed in his duties." Lee was fired on June 20, 2012, by Sanford City Manager Norton Bonaparte.{{cite news|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/2012/06/20/2860209/sanford-police-chief-bill-lee.html|title=Sanford Police Chief Bill Lee fired in wake of Trayvon Martin case|last=Rutland|first=Meredith|date=June 20, 2012|work=Miami Herald|accessdate=June 21, 2012}} Lee responded by saying, "I continue to stand by the work performed by the Sanford Police Department in this tragic shooting, which has been plagued by misrepresentations and false statements for interests other than justice."{{cite news |url=http://www.myfoxorlando.com/story/18839930/sanford-police-chief-bill-lee-fired |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120622041618/http://www.myfoxorlando.com/story/18839930/sanford-police-chief-bill-lee-fired |dead-url=yes |archive-date=June 22, 2012 |title=Sanford Police Chief Bill Lee fired|publisher=[[WOFL]] |date=June 20, 2012|accessdate=June 20, 2012}} On June 26, 2012, the lead investigator of the case, Christopher Serino, was transferred from the Sanford Police Department's investigative unit and reassigned to the patrol division at his own request.{{cite news |title=Lead investigator in Trayvon Martin case transferred out of investigative unit|url=http://www.wftv.com/news/local/lead-investigator-trayvon-martin-case-transferred-/288025893|publisher=WFTV Channel 9 Orlando |date=June 26, 2012 |accessdate=June 26, 2012}} Serino said he felt pressured by several of his fellow police officers to press charges against Zimmerman, although he believed there was not enough evidence to do so. One of the officers pressuring him was a friend of Martin's father. In September 2012, Orlando TV station [[WFTV]] released a leaked memo in which interim police chief Richard Myers blamed the police department spokesperson, Sgt. David Morgenstern, for having mishandled the Travyon Martin case. Myers removed Morgenstern from that position.{{cite news |title=Memo: Sanford police chief blames spokesman for mishandling Trayvon Martin case|url=http://www.wftv.com/news/news/wftv-obtained-memo-interim-police-chief-blames-dep/nR5HZ/|publisher=WFTV Channel 9 Orlando |date=September 6, 2012 |accessdate=September 7, 2012}} ===Martin family attorneys=== [[Benjamin Crump]], the lawyer representing the interests of the Martin family, operates a law firm in [[Tallahassee, Florida]], with his partner Daryl Parks.[http://parkscrump.com/attorneys/benjamin-crump/ Benjamin L. Crump, Attorney Profile] parkscrump.com/attorneys The firm has eight lawyers who focus on [[wrongful death]], [[malpractice]], [[personal injury]] and [[civil rights]].{{cite news |title=Trayvon Martin: Controversy, racial strife familiar for attorney Benjamin Crump Martin shooting transforms part-time mayor|agency=Reuters|date=March 29, 2012|work=Chicago Tribune}} ==Background of the shooting== [[File:Retreat at Twin Lakes entrance.jpeg|thumb|[[The Retreat at Twin Lakes]], north entrance]] The Retreat at Twin Lakes is a 260-unit, gated, townhome community in Sanford, Florida.{{Cite web|url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2012/03/23/did-trayvon-shooter-abuse-911.html |title=Did Trayvon Shooter Abuse 911? |first=Matthew |last=DeLuca |publisher=[[The Daily Beast]] |date=March 22, 2012}}{{cite news|last=Barry|first=Dan|title=Race, Tragedy and Outrage Collide After a Shot in Florida|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/04/02/us/trayvon-martin-shooting-prompts-a-review-of-ideals.html?pagewanted=all|newspaper=The New York Times|date=April 1, 2012}} The population of the development at the time of the shooting was about 49% non-Hispanic white, 23% Hispanic (of any race), 20% black, and 5% Asian, according to Census figures.{{cite news |url=http://www.miamiherald.com/2012/03/17/v-fullstory/2700249/shooter-of-trayvon-martin-a-habitual.html |title=Shooter of Trayvon Martin a habitual caller to cops |last=Robles |first=Frances |date=March 17, 2012 |work=Miami Herald |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130715203814/http://www.miamiherald.com/2012/03/17/v-fullstory/2700249/trayvon-martin-shooter-a-habitual.html|archivedate=July 15, 2013}} Both George Zimmerman and Tracy Martin's fiancée were renting homes in the development at the time of the shooting. Martin had been staying with his father's fiancée at The Retreat. From January 1, 2011, through February 26, 2012, police were called to The Retreat at Twin Lakes 402 times. Crimes committed at The Retreat in the year prior to Martin's death had included eight burglaries, nine thefts, and one shooting.{{cite web|last=DeLuca|first=Matthew|title=Did Trayvon shooter abuse 911|url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2012/03/23/did-trayvon-shooter-abuse-911.html |publisher=The Daily Beast |accessdate=June 28, 2012}} Twin Lakes residents said there were dozens of reports of attempted break-ins, which had created an atmosphere of fear in their neighborhood. In September 2011, the Twin Lakes residents held an organizational meeting to create a neighborhood watch program. Zimmerman was selected by neighbors as the program's coordinator, according to Wendy Dorival, Neighborhood Watch organizer for the Sanford Police Department.{{cite news |last=Jacobson|first=Susan|title=Trayvon Martin: Trayvon Martin shooter George Zimmerman broke neighborhood watch gun rules|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2012-03-24/news/os-trayvon-martin-neighborhood-watch-20120321_1_zimmerman-community-ties-neighborhood-watch|work=Orlando Sentinel|accessdate=July 7, 2012}} Zimmerman had made nearly 50 calls to police between 2004 and 2012 to report various local disturbances, such as loud parties, open garage doors, potholes, and children playing in the street.{{cite news|last=Weinstein|first=Adam|title=Trayvon shooter's 911 calls: potholes, piles of trash -- and black men|url=https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2012/03/trayvon-shooters-911-calls-potholes-piles-trash-black-men|newspaper=Mother Jones|date=March 22, 2012}} Following break-ins in the neighborhood in 2011, Zimmerman's calls to police increasingly focused on reporting people he suspected of criminal activity. During the months leading up to the February 26, 2012, shooting, Zimmerman called the police several times to report people he believed to be suspicious. On each of the calls, Zimmerman offered information about the race of the suspects only when specifically asked by the dispatcher to do so; his reports said that all were black males.{{cite news|last=Faussett|first=Richard|title=Trayvon Martin and George Zimmerman: a portrait of the Retreat|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2012/may/18/nation/la-na-nn-zimmerman-hoa-newsletters-20120518|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|date=May 18, 2012}}{{cite news|last=Hightower|first=Kyle|last2=Schneider|first2=Mike|title=Judge in Trayvon Martin case weighs police calls|url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/prosecutors-want-admit-calls-zimmerman-trial|publisher=Associated Press|date=June 26, 2013}}{{cite news|last=Isikoff|first=Michael|title=In police calls, Zimmerman mentioned race only when asked|url=http://usnews.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2012/04/05/11045284-in-police-calls-zimmerman-mentioned-race-only-when-asked?lite|publisher=NBC News|accessdate=June 28, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120508032605/http://usnews.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2012/04/05/11045284-in-police-calls-zimmerman-mentioned-race-only-when-asked?lite|archivedate=May 8, 2012|df=mdy-all}}{{#tag:ref|[http://www.wagist.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/911CallHistory.pdf Police Event Reports for calls made by Zimmerman (911 and non-emergency)]|group="Note"}} According to friends and neighbors of Zimmerman, three weeks prior to the shooting on February 2, Zimmerman called police to report a young man peering into the windows of an empty Twin Lakes home. By the time police arrived, the suspect had fled. On February 6, workers witnessed two young black men lingering in the yard of a Twin Lakes resident around the same time a new laptop and some gold jewelry was stolen from her home. The next day police discovered the stolen laptop in the backpack of a young black man whom Zimmerman identified as the same person he had spotted peering into windows on February 2. Zimmerman had been licensed to carry a firearm since November 2009. ==Shooting== {{Main|Timeline of the shooting of Trayvon Martin}} On the evening of February 26, 2012, Zimmerman observed Martin as he returned to the Twin Lakes housing community after having walked to a nearby convenience store.{{cite news |first=Charles M. |last=Blow |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/03/17/opinion/blow-the-curious-case-of-trayvon-martin.html |title=The Curious Case of Trayvon Martin |date=March 16, 2012 |work=The New York Times |accessdate=March me|url=http://news.blogs.cnn.com/2012/06/21/george-zimmerman-trayvon-martin-attacked-me/|publisher=CNN|accessdate=June 28, 2012|date=June 21, 2012}} {{Listen | filename = Trayvon Martin Shooting He reported finding Zimmerman standing near Martin, who was lying face down in the grass and unresponsive.{{cite web|title=Sanford Police Initial Report|url=http://www.wagist.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/Twin-Lakes-Shooting-Initial-Report.pdf|date=February 26, 2012|publisher=wagist.com|accessdate=April 7, 2012|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6IDic8eqB?url=http://www.wagist.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/Twin-Lakes-Shooting-Initial-Report.pdf|archivedate=July 19, 2013|deadurl=yes|df=mdy-all}}{{cite news |last=Gutman|first=Matt|title=Trayvon Martin Case: Timeline of Events|url=http://abcnews.go.com/blogs/headlines/2012/05/trayvon-martin-case-timeline-of-events/|publisher=ABC News|accessdate=May 21, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120505110815/http://abcnews.go.com/blogs/headlines/2012/05/trayvon-martin-case-timeline-of-events/|archivedate=May 5, 2012|df=mdy-all}} At that time, Zimmerman stated to Smith that he had shot Martin and was still armed. Smith handcuffed Zimmerman and confiscated his black [[Kel-Tec PF-9]] [[9×19mm|9mm]] semi-automatic pistol. Smith observed that Zimmerman's back was wet and covered with grass, and he was bleeding from the nose and the back of his head.{{cite news |last=Stutzman|first=Rene|title=Trayvon Martin; Zimmerman Account|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2012-03-26/news/os-trayvon-martin-zimmerman-account-20120326_1_miami-schools-punch-unarmed-black-teenager|work=[[Orlando Sentinel]]|accessdate=March 30, 2012}} Ricardo Ayala, the second officer to arrive that night, noticed Officer Smith had Zimmerman in custody, then observed Martin lying face down in the grass and attempted to get a response from him. At this time, Sgt. Anthony Raimondo arrived and together with Ayala began [[CPR]]. [[Paramedic]]s from Sanford Fire and Rescue arrived and continued CPR, finally declaring Martin dead at 7:30 p.m. Other officers who had arrived by this time secured the area and made contact with neighbors in the area and obtained statements from witnesses at the scene. The officers, who believed Zimmerman proceeded solely on foot before the attack, did not seize Zimmerman's vehicle until after his wife had moved it.{{cite news|last=Kovaleski|first=Serge F.|title=Trayvon Martin Case Shadowed by Series of Police Missteps|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/17/us/trayvon-martin-case-shadowed-by-police-missteps.html|date=May 16, 2012|accessdate=August 24, 2013}} Zimmerman was treated and released by paramedics while still at the scene of the incident. After placing Zimmerman in his police vehicle, Officer Smith heard Zimmerman say, "I was yelling for someone to help me, but no one would help me."{{cite news |last=Stutzman|first=Rene|title=Father wants crime watch volunteer who killed son arrested|url=http://www.standard.net/stories/2012/03/08/father-wants-crime-watch-volunteer-who-killed-son-arrested |work=Standard-Examiner |location=Ogden, Utah |accessdate=March 30, 2012}} Zimmerman was then transported to the [[Sanford Police Department (Florida)|Sanford Police Department]] where he was questioned by investigators for approximately five hours.{{cite news|last=Strassman|first=Mark|title=What happened right after Trayvon Martin's shooting?|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-18563_162-57405476/what-happened-right-after-trayvon-martins-shooting|date=March 27, 2012|accessdate=May 21, 2012|publisher=CBS News}} The police determined that Zimmerman yelled for help at least 14 times in a 38-second span.{{cite news |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Nightline/video/trayvon-martin-explosive-evidence-16374729 |title=Trayvon Martin: Explosive New Evidence | Video |publisher=ABC News |date=May 17, 2012 |accessdate=July 4, 2012}} The question of who was calling for help has been disputed since then by others and remains inconclusive. (See [[#Background yells for help in 9-1-1 calls|Background yells for help in 9-1-1 calls]]) [[File:George Zimmerman front of head.jpg|thumb|upright|George Zimmerman with a bloody, swollen nose in the back seat of a police car on the night of the shooting{{cite web | url = http://gzlegalcase.com/index.php/press-releases/67-george-zimmerman-photograph | title = George Zimmerman Photograph | accessdate = December 3, 2012 | last = O'Mara | first = Mark | date = December 3, 2012 | work = GeorgeZimmerman Legal Case | publisher = George Zimmerman Legal Defense Fund | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20121205223609/http://gzlegalcase.com/index.php/press-releases/67-george-zimmerman-photograph | archivedate = December 5, 2012 | df = mdy-all }}{{cite news | first = Barbara | last = Liston | title = Bloody new photo of Trayvon Martin's killer released | date = December 3, 2012 | url = https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/12/03/us-usa-florida-shooting-idUSBRE8B218K20121203 |agency=Reuters | accessdate = December 3, 2012}}]] [[File:George Zimmerman back of head.jpg|thumb|The back of Zimmerman's head at the police station[http://abcnews.go.com/US/slideshow/george-zimmerman-leaves-jail-16126443 Trayvon Martin Crime Scene Photos] ABC News – See picture number 2.]] On the night of the shooting, Zimmerman was taken in for questioning. He arrived to the police station at 7:52 p.m., according to a police video. Zimmerman was interviewed by Investigator D. Singleton and by Detective Chris Serino.{{cite web|last=Martosko |first=David |title=Police Incident Report Fills in Details on Trayvon Martin Shooting |url=http://dailycaller.com/2012/03/27/police-incident-fills-in-details-on-trayvon-martin-shooting/ |accessdate=March 31, 2012 |date=March 27, 2012 }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} He also underwent a [[voice stress analysis]] test in an attempt to see if he was lying, and he passed (indicating he was likely telling the truth). Crime Scene Tech D. Smith photographed his injuries and hands and collected gunshot residue. Zimmerman's weapon was placed into evidence.{{cite news|last=Gray|first=Madison|title=George Zimmermans Gun a Popular Choice for Concealed Carry|url=http://newsfeed.time.com/2012/03/28/george-zimmermans-gun-a-popular-choice-for-concealed-carry/|work=Time|accessdate=March 31, 2012|date=March 28, 2012}} His clothes were also taken as evidence after his wife arrived with a change of clothes. Five hours later, Zimmerman was released. The police chief said that there was no evidence to refute Zimmerman's claim of having acted in self-defense, and that under Florida's [[Stand-your-ground law|Stand Your Ground]] statute, the police were prohibited by law from making an arrest.{{cite news|last=Robles|first=Frances|title=Sanford cops sought warrant to arrest George Zimmerman in Trayvon Martin shooting|url=http://www.tampabay.com/news/publicsafety/crime/sanford-cops-sought-warrant-to-arrest-george-zimmerman-in-trayvon-martin/1222259|newspaper=Tampa Bay Times|date=March 27, 2012}} The police chief also said that Zimmerman had a right to defend himself with lethal force.{{cite news|last=Lee|first=Trymaine|title=Trayvon Martin Case: Police Chief Bill Lee Under Fire With 'No Confidence' Vote|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/03/22/trayvon-martin-case-george-zimmerman-bill-lee_n_1371635.html|publisher=The Huffington Post|date=March 22, 2012}} The day after the shooting, Zimmerman performed a videotaped reenactment of the incident for police. Some observers, such as University of Florida law professor and defense attorney Michelle Jacobs{{cite news|last=Alcindor|first=Yamiche|title=Trayvon Martin's killing now a murder case|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/news/nation/story/2012-04-12/george-zimmerman-charges-trayvon-martin-shooting/54191768/1|newspaper=USA Today|date=April 12, 2012|author2=Bello, Marisol|author3=Welch, William M.}} and Columbia University law professor Patricia Williams,{{cite news|last=Williams|first=Patricia J.|title=The real injustice at the heart of the Trayvon Martin case: what makes this case exceptional is neither race nor the politics of self-defense alone but the total failure to investigate it for so long|url=http://www.thenation.com/article/167455/real-injustice-heart-trayvon-martin-case|newspaper=The Nation|date=April 18, 2012}} said that the police failed to fully investigate the shooting when they did not test Zimmerman for drugs or alcohol intoxication. However, Miami, Florida police experts told the ''Miami Herald'' that homicide suspects are not typically tested for drugs or alcohol unless the suspect has been accused of having been driving while intoxicated.{{cite news|last=Robles|first=Frances|title=A look at what happened the night Trayvon Martin died|url=http://www.tampabay.com/news/publicsafety/crime/a-look-at-what-happened-the-night-trayvon-martin-died/1223083|newspaper=Miami Herald|date=April 2, 2012}} ===Martin's body identified=== Martin's body was taken to the [[morgue]], where he was tagged as a [[John Doe]], as he was not carrying any identification. The mobile phone found at the shooting scene was malfunctioning to the point that the police [[Cellebrite]] data recovery device could not access it.Serino, Christopher (February 26, 2012). [http://msnbcmedia.msn.com/i/msnbc/sections/news/Zimmerman_Discovery.pdf "Offense Report"]. Case No. 201250001136. Sanford Police Department. Martin's father, Tracy Martin, called to file a Missing Persons report early on February 28, and police officers arrived at his fiancée's condo with photographs of his dead son about 9:20 a.m.{{cite news|last=Trotta|first=Daniel|title=Trayvon Martin: Before the World Heard the Cries|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/04/03/us-usa-florida-shooting-trayvon-idUSBRE8320UK20120403|agency=Reuters|date=April 3, 2012 |accessdate=April 7, 2012}}{{cite news |last=Serino |first=Chris|title=Report of Investigation (page 5 of 13)|url=http://msnbcmedia.msn.com/i/msnbc/sections/news/Zimmerman_Discovery.pdf |date=March 13, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}} The Martin family alleged that Seminole County Attorney Wolfinger met personally with Sanford Chief Lee on the night of the shooting and instructed Lee not to make an arrest. Based on their accusation, the Martin family requested that the Justice Department investigate the State prosecutor's office. Wolfinger responded that the family's accusations were "outright lies" and denied that any such meeting or communication took place. Wolfinger's office reported that the Sanford police consulted with Kelly Jo Hines, the prosecutor on call the night of the shooting, but it has not been disclosed what was talked about.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/04/02/us-usa-florida-shooting-prosecutor-idUSBRE83116420120402|author1=Trotta, Daniel|author2=Liston, Barbara|title=Prosecutor denies interfering in Florida shooting case|agency=Reuters|date=April 2, 2012|accessdate=June 15, 2012}} ===State Attorney's investigation=== On March 12, 2012, Police Chief Lee turned the investigation over to the State Attorney's office for review.{{cite news|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/2012/03/12/2690445/sanford-chief-no-charges-yet-in.html|title=Sanford chief: Shooting death of Miami teen turned over to state attorney|work=Miami Herald|date=March 12, 2012|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120320034612/http://www.miamiherald.com/2012/03/12/2690445/sanford-chief-no-charges-yet-in.html|archivedate=March 20, 2012}} Link only works with [[Javascript]] disabled Lee said there was not enough evidence to arrest Zimmerman. "In this case Mr. Zimmerman has made the statement of self-defense," Lee said. "Until we can establish probable cause to dispute that, we don't have the grounds to arrest him." In response to criticisms of the investigation, Lee responded that "We are taking a beating over this" and defended the investigation.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/03/19/us-crime-florida-idUSBRE82I01920120319|title=FBI monitoring fatal Florida shooting case, as police criticized|last1=Adams|first1=David|last2=Brown|first2=Tom| last3=Pelofsky|first3=Jeremy|date=March 18, 2012|agency=Reuters|accessdate=March 20, 2012}} "This is all very unsettling. I'm sure if George Zimmerman had the opportunity to relive Sunday, February 26, he'd probably do things differently. I'm sure Trayvon would, too."{{by whom|date=January 2016}} On March 13, 2012, Chris Serino sent a ''[[capias]]'' request to the state's attorney recommending charges of [[manslaughter|negligent manslaughter]] against Zimmerman, though Serino maintains he did not believe they had the evidence to support those charges and that manslaughter was only included in the ''capias'' in order for the prosecutor's office to continue with their own investigation.{{cite news |last=Stutzman |first=Rene |url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2012-07-07/news/os-george-zimmerman-sanford-police-lied-20120707_1_special-prosecutor-angela-corey-chief-bill-lee-arrest-warrant |title=George Zimmerman arrest Sanford: Police gave mixed messages about George Zimmerman's arrest |work=Orlando Sentinel |date=July 7, 2012 |accessdate=September 28, 2012}}{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/martin-familys-attorney-seeks-justice-dept-investigation-into-police-actions-after-shooting/2012/04/02/gIQAnD2prS_singlePage.html| title=Martin family's attorney seeks Justice Dept. investigation into police actions after shooting| last=Horwitz|first=Sari|author2=White, Josh |date=April 2, 2012|work=The Washington Post | accessdate=April 5, 2012}}{{cite news|title=Documents shed more light on Trayvon Martin shooting|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2012/may/18/nation/la-na-trayvon-martin-20120518|work=Los Angeles Times|accessdate=May 21, 2012|first1=Richard|last1=Fausset|first2=Michael|last2=Muskal|first3=Molly|last3=Hennessy-Fiske|date=May 18, 2012}} The ''capias'' states, "the encounter between George Zimmerman and Trayvon Martin was ultimately avoidable by Zimmerman, if Zimmerman had remained in his vehicle and waited the arrival of law enforcement or conversely if he had identified himself to Martin as a concerned citizen and initiated dialog in an effort to dispel each party's concern.... There is no indication that Trayvon Martin was involved in any criminal activity at the time of the encounter."{{cite news |author1=Robles, Frances |author2=Caputo, Marc, |author3=Burch, Audra D.S. |title=Evidence is released in the Trayvon Martin homicide|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/2012/05/17/v-fullstory/2804442/law-officers-set-to-release-evidence.html|work=Miami Herald|date=May 17, 2012|accessdate=May 21, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130712051703/http://www.miamiherald.com/2012/05/17/v-fullstory/2804442/law-officers-set-to-release-evidence.html|archivedate=July 12, 2013|df=mdy-all}} The State Attorney's office initially determined there was insufficient evidence to charge Zimmerman and did not file charges based on the ''capias'' request.{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2012/03/14/justice/florida-teen-shooting|title=Fatal shooting of Florida teen turned over to state attorney|last=Kuo|first=Vivian|date=March 14, 2012|publisher=CNN|accessdate=March 14, 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2114152/Trayvon-Martin-shot-dead-Police-say-theres-evidence-dispute-claim-neighbourhood-watch-captain-George-Zimmerman-acted-self-defence.html|title=Neighbourhood watch captain who shot unarmed black teen 'had history of aggressive tactics'- but won't face charges|date=March 12, 2012|work=Daily Mail|accessdate=March 14, 2012|location=London}} On March 16, Serino told the ''[[Orlando Sentinel]]'' that his investigation had turned up no reliable evidence that cast doubt on Zimmerman's account; that he had acted in self-defense. "The best evidence we have is the testimony of George Zimmerman, and he says the [[decedent]] was the primary aggressor in the whole event, everything I have is adding up to what he says."{{cite news|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2012-04-02/news/os-trayvon-martin-federal-review-justice-letter-20120402_1_chief-bill-lee-federal-review-federal-agency|title=Lawyer for Trayvon's family: Wolfinger and police chief met the night teen was killed|work=Orlando Sentinel|date=April 2, 2012|author=Stutzman, Renee|accessdate=June 26, 2012}} ===FDLE and FBI investigations=== On March 20, 2012, State attorney Norm Wolfinger announced that a [[Seminole County, Florida|Seminole County]] [[grand jury]] would be convened on April 10 to investigate the death of Martin.{{cite news |url=http://usnews.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2012/03/20/10775671-trayvon-martin-case-to-go-to-grand-jury-fla-state-attorney-announces |title=Trayvon Martin case to go to grand jury, Fla. state attorney announces |accessdate=March 29, 2012 |date=March 20, 2012 |publisher=[[MSNBC]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120322210152/http://usnews.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2012/03/20/10775671-trayvon-martin-case-to-go-to-grand-jury-fla-state-attorney-announces |archivedate=March 22, 2012 |df=mdy-all }}{{Cite news|url = http://www.wftv.com/news/news/state-attorney-case-will-be-given-grand-jury-shoot/nLX9c/|title = Crowds at rally call for gunman George Zimmerman's arrest in Trayvon Martin's death|publisher = WFTV|agency=Associated Press|date = March 20, 2012|accessdate = August 13, 2013}}{{cite news|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2012-03-20/news/os-trayvon-martin-doj-investigation-20120320_1_grand-jury-investigation-sanford|title=Grand jury, Department of Justice to investigate Trayvon Martin shooting|last1=Hernández|first1=Arelis R.|last2=Stutzman|first2=Rene|date=March 20, 2012|work=Orlando Sentinel|accessdate=March 20, 2012}} However, after State Attorney Angela Corey was assigned to the case by [[state governor|Florida Governor]] [[Rick Scott]] on March 22, she decided that her office would decide whether to press charges. She commented: "I always lean towards moving forward without needing the grand jury in a case like this, I foresee us being able to make a decision, and move on it on our own."{{cite news|last=Olorunnipa|first=Toluse|title= Prosecutor at center of Trayvon Martin case known as tough, hard-nosed | url=http://www.tampabay.com/news/publicsafety/crime/prosecutor-at-center-of-trayvon-martin-case-known-as-tough-hard-nosed/1222217|newspaper=Tampa Bay Times| date=March 28, 2012}} Also published by the ''Miami Herald'' as "Tough Minded Prosecutor In Spotlight On Trayvon Martin Case". Governor Scott asked the [[Florida Department of Law Enforcement]] (FDLE) to investigate the shooting{{cite news|url=http://miamiherald.typepad.com/nakedpolitics/2012/03/gov-scott-asks-fdle-to-investigate-trayvon-martin.html|title=Gov. Scott asks FDLE to investigate Trayvon Martin's shooting|last=Klas|first=Mary Ellen|date=March 19, 2012|work=Miami Herald|accessdate=March 20, 2012}}{{cite news|last=Gutman|first=Matt|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/fbi-justice-department-investigate-trayvon-martin-killing/story?id=15955985 |title = FBI, Justice Department to Investigate Killing of Trayvon Martin by Neighborhood Watchman |accessdate=March 29, 2012|date=March 19, 2012}} and Florida Attorney General [[Pam Bondi]] confirmed that the FDLE was involved and stated "no stone will be left unturned in this investigation". On March 20, 2012, the [[United States Department of Justice|Justice Department]] announced that it was opening investigations into the incident.{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/03/19/justice/florida-teen-shooting|title=Justice Department, FBI to probe Florida teen's death|date=March 20, 2012|publisher=CNN|accessdate=March 20, 2012}} The FBI opened a parallel investigation into whether Martin's [[civil rights]] were violated, interviewed witnesses, and looked into Zimmerman's background.{{cite news |url=http://usnews.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2012/04/02/10983757-fbi-questions-people-in-trayvon-martin-case-begins-parallel-investigation |title=FBI questions people in Trayvon Martin case, begins 'parallel investigation' |publisher=[[MSNBC]] |accessdate=April 4, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120404030829/http://usnews.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2012/04/02/10983757-fbi-questions-people-in-trayvon-martin-case-begins-parallel-investigation |archivedate=April 4, 2012 |df=mdy-all }} On July 12, 2012, reports of some of the more than 30 interviews conducted by the FBI were released by Special Prosecutor Angela Corey to Zimmerman's attorney, who released them to the public. The released reports do not draw any conclusions in the DOJ investigation. The Sanford Police Department's lead investigator, Chris Serino, told FBI agents that he believed Zimmerman's actions were not based on Martin's race, but instead on Martin's attire, the circumstances of the encounter, and previous burglaries in the neighborhood. Zimmerman's neighbors and co-workers were interviewed as well. Neighbors who knew Zimmerman had nothing derogatory to say about him and his co-workers were complimentary of him.{{cite news|last=Hayes|first=Ashley|title=Witnesses tell FBI that George Zimmerman is no racist|url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/07/12/justice/florida-teen-shooting/index.html|publisher=CNN|accessdate=July 13, 2012|date=July 13, 2012}} Serino also told the FBI that he had felt pressure from three officers within the department to charge Zimmerman although he "did not believe he had enough evidence at the time to file charges", and accused one of these officers of being friendly with Martin's father. He also expressed concern to the FBI about possible leaks of evidence to the media from within the department. On July 13, 2013, shortly after the trial verdict, the U.S. Justice Department issued a statement saying its investigation into the civil rights aspects of the case was continuing.{{cite news|last=Effron|first=Lauren|title=George Zimmerman Could Face Civil Suits, Death Threats, Federal Prosecution|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/george-zimmerman-face-civil-suits-death-threats-federal/story?id=19661599|publisher=ABC News|date=July 14, 2013|accessdate=August 26, 2013}} On February 24, 2015, 35 months after it began, the civil rights investigation of the Justice Department was terminated for lack of evidence. The FBI investigation was concurrently terminated for the same reason.{{cite web|url=http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/federal-officials-close-investigation-death-trayvon-martin |title=Federal Officials Close Investigation Into Death of Trayvon Martin | OPA | Department of Justice |publisher=U.S. Department of Justice |date=2015-02-24 |accessdate=2016-07-08}} ===County medical examiner's autopsy report=== The Volusia County medical examiner found that Martin was killed by an injury resulting from a single gunshot to the chest, fired at "intermediate range" between 1 and 18 inches (3–46 cm), according to a forensic expert.{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2012/05/17/autopsy-reportedly-shows-trayvon-martin-died-from-single-gunshot-wound-fired-at/ | publisher=Fox News Channel| title=Autopsy of Trayvon Martin reportedly shows fatal bullet fired from 'intermediate range' | date=May 17, 2012}}{{#tag:ref| The autopsy report can be found at {{cite news | title = Trayvon Martin Autopsy Report: Killed By Bullet Fired At Intermediate Range | url = http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/05/17/trayvon-martin-autopsy_n_1525763.html | publisher = The Huffington Post | accessdate = September 18, 2012 | first=Benjamin | last=Hart | date=May 17, 2012}}|group = "Note"|name = "autrep"}} An FDLE analysis of Martin's body and clothes described the distance as "a contact shot".{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trayvon-martin-autospy-report-indicates-struggle/2012/05/17/gIQAxw6HXU_singlePage.html |title=Trayvon Martin documents reveal new details in case |work=The Washington Post |date=May 18, 2012 |accessdate=June 12, 2013 |first1=Sari |last1=Horwitz |first2=Stephanie |last2=McCrummen}} The autopsy also found that Martin had one small abrasion on his left ring finger below the knuckle. No other injuries were found on Martin's body at the time of his death. Physicians who reviewed the official autopsy report for the ''Orlando Sentinel'' stated in their opinion that Martin lived from 20 seconds to several minutes after he was shot, and that Martin likely remained conscious "for a little time, anyway".{{cite news |last=Stutzman|first=Rene|title=Trayvon Martin's hear: Experts: Trayvon's heart kept pumping after shooting|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2012-08-17/news/os-trayvon-martin-autopsy-20120817_1_trayvon-martin-george-zimmerman-blood-loss|work=Orlando Sentinel|accessdate=August 21, 2012}} The [[autopsy]] report stated that Martin had trace levels of THC, the active ingredient in [[marijuana]], in his blood and urine. The [[toxicology]] report found the levels to be 1.5 [[nanogram]]s/ml of [[Tetrahydrocannabinol|THC]] and 7.3 nanograms/ml of [[THC-COOH]], a [[metabolite]] of THC that can stay in the system for weeks after [[cannabis (drug)|cannabis]] has been smoked.{{cite news|last=Szalavitz|first=Maia|title=Traces of marijuana found in Trayvon Martin's body; Does it matter?|url=http://healthland.time.com/2012/05/18/traces-of-marijuana-found-in-trayvon-martins-body-does-it-matter-2/|work=Time|accessdate=May 19, 2012|date=May 18, 2012}}{{cite news|title=More details emerge in Trayvon Martin investigation |url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/05/18/justice/florida-teen-shooting/index.html?hpt=hp_t2 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=May 19, 2012 |date=May 19, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120519000523/http://www.cnn.com/2012/05/18/justice/florida-teen-shooting/index.html?hpt=hp_t2 |archivedate=May 19, 2012 }} Larry Kobilinsky, a professor of [[forensic science]], stated that the THC amount was so low that it may have been ingested days earlier and played no role in Martin's behavior.{{cite news|title=New evidence show wounds on Zimmerman's head and THC found in Martin's body|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-504083_162-57437018-504083/trayvon-martin-shooting-new-evidence-shows-wounds-on-zimmermans-head-thc-found-in-martins-body/|publisher=CBS news|accessdate=May 19, 2012}} While under oath, the medical examiner who performed the autopsy testified that "marijuana could have no effect or some effect" on Martin's behavior.{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10169761/Trayvon-Martin-had-marijuana-in-system-night-he-died.html | location=London | work=The Daily Telegraph | first=Jon | last=Swaine | title=Trayvon Martin 'had marijuana in system night he died' | date=July 9, 2013}} ===Witness accounts===
